dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This ownership dataset utilizes a methodology that results in a federal ownership extent that matches the Federal Responsibility Areas (FRA) footprint from CAL FIRE's State Responsibility Areas for Fire Protection (SRA) data. FRA lands are snapped to county parcel data, thus federal ownership areas will also be snapped.

Since SRA Fees were first implemented in 2011, CAL FIRE has devoted significant resources to improve the quality of SRA data. This includes comparing SRA data to data from other federal, state, and local agencies, an annual comparison to county assessor roll files, and a formal SRA review process that includes input from CAL FIRE Units. As a result, FRA lands provide a solid basis as the footprint for federal lands in California (except in the southeastern desert area).

The methodology for federal lands involves: 1) snapping federal data sources to parcels; 2) clipping to the FRA footprint; 3) overlaying the federal data sources and using a hierarchy when sources overlap to resolve coding issues (BIA, UFW, NPS, USF, BLM, DOD, ACE, BOR); 4) utilizing an automated process to merge “unknown” FRA slivers with appropriate adjacent ownerships; and 5) a manual review of FRA areas not assigned a federal agency by this process.

Non-Federal ownership information was obtained from the California Protected Areas Database (CPAD), was clipped to the non-FRA area, and an automated process was used to fill in some sliver-gaps that occurred between the federal and non-federal data.

Southeastern Desert Area: CAL FIRE does not devote the same level of resources for maintaining SRA data in this region of the state, since we have no fire protection responsibility. This includes almost all of Imperial County, and the desert portions of Riverside, and San Bernardino Counties. In these areas, we used federal protection areas from the current version of the Direct Protection Areas (DPA) dataset.

Due to the fact that there were draw-issues with the previous version of ownership, this version does NOT fill in the areas that are not assigned to one of the owner groups (it does not cover all lands in the state). Also unlike previous versions of the dataset, this version only defines ownership down to the agency level - it does not contain more specific property information (for example, which National Forest). The option for a more detailed future release remains, however, and due to the use of automated tools, could always be created without much additional effort.

This dataset includes a representation to symbolize based on the Own_Group field using the standard color scheme utilized on DPA maps.

For more details about data inputs, see the Lineage section of the metadata.

For detailed notes on previous versions, see the Supplemental Information section of the metadata.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: This dataset is intended to provide a statewide depiction of land ownership in California. It utilizes a methodology that results in federal lands being snapped to county parcel data (see Description for details). It nominally represents ownership patterns as of 7/1/2013, since the vintage for the various input datasets varies.

Consts.useLimit:
DISCLAIMER

The State of California and the Department of Forestry and Fire Protection make no representations or warranties regarding the accuracy of data or maps. The user will not seek to hold the State or the Department liable under any circumstances for any damages with respect to any claim by the user or any third party on account of or arising from the use of data or maps.

OTHER LIMITATIONS

There are no restrictions on distribution of the data by users. However, users are encouraged to refer others to the Department of Forestry and Fire Protection to acquire the data, in case updated data become available. The user will cite the California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection as the original source of the data, but will clearly denote cases where the original data have been altered, updated, or in any way changed from the original condition.

dataIdInfo.suppInfo:
Notes from previous ownership versions:
**************************************** ownership11_3 notes: ****************************************
Version 11_3 is identical to 11_2 except for one major error correction. Over 20,000 acres of private land near Icehouse in Eldorado was calssified as U.S. Forest Service in 11_2, this has been corrected.
**************************************** ownership11_2 notes: ****************************************
Updates from version 11_1 to 11_2:
* New CPAD input * Different BIA input (more accurate than that used in 11_1)
This dataset was created by combining multiple datasets, as follows:
1) Start with "State" 2) Update with "CPAD1.7" 3) Update with "BIA2009" 4) Update with "DOD2009" 5) Update with "prisons" 6) Update with "universities" 7) Update with "other overrides" 8) Add [ownership] field and fill in appropriately 9) Add [DPAcode] field and fill in appropriately
The individual components mentioned above where created as follows:
1) State - The "State" input was created using the 24k Counties dataset (cnty24k09_1) as the starting point. The individual counties were dissolved into one feature to create an overall coverage of the state of California (including islands). The attributes of the dataset were then changed to include just four user-defined fields: [Jurisdiction], [Agency], [Property] and [Source]. The value of [Source] was set to "statepoly". The other three fields were set to "Unknown".
2) CPAD1.7 - The "CPAD1.7" input was created using CPAD1.7 as a starting point. The attributes of the dataset were then changed to include just four user-defined fields: [Jurisdiction], [Agency], [Property] and [Source]. The values were filled in as follows: [Jurisdiction]=[Agency_Lev], [Agency]=[Agency_Name], [Property]=[Site_Name], [Source]="CPAD1.7"
3) BIA2009 - The "BIA2009" input was created using a 2009 version of BIA lands as a starting point. The boundaries of the features were subsequently alligned to parcels where possible. The attributes of the dataset were then changed to include just four user-defined fields: [Jurisdiction], [Agency], [Property] and [Source]. The values of [Jurisdiction] was filled in as "Federal", [Agency] was set to "Bureau of Indian Affairs", [Property] was filled in based on [Asset_Type], and [Source] was set to "BIA2009"
4) DOD2009 - The "DOD2009" input was created using "DODlands_ParcelAlign_2009" (provided by GreenInfo) as a starting point. The data was already alligned to parcels where appropriate, with the exception of Imperial county. Boundaries were subsequently alligned to parcels in Imperial county, and where appropriate, road slivers and holes removed. The attributes of the dataset were then changed to include just four user-defined fields: [Jurisdiction], [Agency], [Property] and [Source]. The values were determined as follows: [Jurisdiction]="Federal", [Agency]="United States Department of Defense", [Property]=[Unit_Name], [Source]="DOD2009"
5) prisons - The "prisons" dataset was created from scratch by FRAP personel. Locations were determined using addresses obtained from the California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitations website, and were verified using a combination of: GoogleMaps, NAIP aerial imagery, and aerial photographs of the prisons obtained from the CDCR website. The boundaries of the features were alligned to parcels, utilizing parcel ownership information when available. Four user-defined fields were included in the dataset: [Jurisdiction], [Agency], [Property] and [Source]. The values were set as "State", "California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation", (prison name), & "prisons2011" respectively.
6) universities - The "universities" input was created from scratch by FRAP personel. Locations were determined using addresses obtained from the University of California, California State University, or individual university websites, and were verified using a combination of: GoogleMaps, NAIP aerial imagery, and campus maps obtained from the university websites. Four user-defined fields were included in the dataset: [Jurisdiction], [Agency], [Property] and [Source]. The values were set as "State", "University of California" or "California State University", (university name), & "universities2011" respectively.
7) other overrides - The "other overrides" input was created from scratch by FRAP personel. It contains a few override features to correct locations that were otherwise incorrect based on the above input layers.
8) ownership - This field was filled out based on the [Jurisdiction], [Agency], and [Property] fields, and is the primary field for this dataset. For the purposes of this dataset, all features left over from "State" (ie lands outside CPAD, BIA, DOD, prisons, and universities) were assumed to be "Private". For a list of possible ownership values, see the Attributes section of the metadata.
9) DPAcode - To facilitate the effective use of this dataset for the Ownership to SRA to DPA dataset creation process, the DPAcode field was added. This field was only filled in for Federal lands, utilizing DPA and FOG codes, and may not be complete for this version of the dataset. For details on these codes, see the Attributes section of the metadata.
**************************************** previous ownership version notes: ****************************************
"Update" was chosen as the geoprocessing tool of choice in the creation of this dataset in order to ensure that there would be no overlaping features. However, the dataset has not been checked for slivers or other "odd" features that may have been created due to misalignment of features between the different inputs.
This dataset is complete in the sense that the features extend over the entirety of the state of California. However, the dataset by no means includes all properties, as the vast majority of the private ownership was given a property value of "Unknown", and the completeness of the non-private lands is dependent on the completeness of the individual input datasets. In cases where major property omissions were discovered during the creation process, these properties were added. Also see "Attribute Accuracy".
The accuracy of the ownership information (jurisdiction, agency, property, and ownership) are dependant on the accuracy in the individual inputs that were used to create this dataset. It is also likely that some non-private lands have been incorrectly classifiesd as private due to the assumption that anything not in CPAD, DOD, BIA, prisons, or universities is private. Ommissions from the input datasets may also lead to this mis-identification of lands as private. Likewise, this dataset did not exclude small ownerships such as post-offices, fire stations, police stations, and other city/county/state/federal ownerships that normally reside within city boundaries.

LegConsts.useLimit: See General Constraints for CAL FIRE Disclaimer

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.1.3143

dataLineage.statement:
Ownership13_2:
13_1 contained over 120 private polygons, these were homeowners association polygons from CPAD. These have been removed from 13_2.
Ownership13_1:
The SRA input for the federal boundary was SRA13_2
Federal ownership inputs were obtained from US Forest Service, US National Park Service, US Bureau of Indian Affairs, US Bureau of Land Managment, US Department of Defense, and US Fish and Wildlife Service, with data for Army Corp of Engineers and Bureau of Reclamation obtained from CPAD. As originally obtained, these data were considered current as of July 1 2012 (to match with SRA fees), but received additional updates as a result of AutoDPA review, SRA feedback review, updated BIA dataset review, and draft ownership review. They can thus be considered current as of July 1 2013.
Ownership in the desert zone is based on DPA13_3 (as is SRA)
Non-federal ownership is based on CPAD_2013b_Holdings (in GDB_LIB)
Any sliver fixes were made using the parcel data considered current as of April 2013

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The generalized ownership grouping, based on Own_Level, and/or Own_Agency. These categories match those used in the display of ownership information on Direct Responsibility Area maps.
RuleID Field for the Ownership Group representation (based on Own_Group)

edom.edomvd: CA Dept. of Forestry and Fire Protection
CA Dept. of Parks and Recreation
CA Dept. of Fish and Wildlife

attr.attrdef: Override Field for the Ownership Group representation
